result.execSummary:
The defendant Dartavius L Spencer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED pending review.
**02/19/16-Judge Jeffrey A. Kremers**
Defendant to spend 30 days straight time, with no good time credit, as condition time in the House of Correction for said Defendant's non-compliance with conditions of probation. Defendant taken into custody.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dartavius L Spencer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dartavius L Spencer in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Micha A. Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.
Agent to contact the court if things change to get a new date for another review.

Defendant Dartavius L Spencer not in court.  Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defendant did not appear.
  DOC agent also in court.
The Court finds that the defendant has not been complying with the conditions of probation.  The Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 DAYS of the condition time that was stayed to today's date; the stay on the balance of the time is to continue to the next court date.  Defendant taken into custody.  Filed, signed Order For Commitment Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions.
Case adjourned to 04/05/2016 at 1:30 p.m. for probation review hearing in Branch 36.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for April 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dartavius L Spencer in court.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
The Court ordered another review hearing to further monitor the defendant.  The Court ordered the stay on the condition time to continue until the next court date.  
Case adjourned to 02/19/2016 at 1:30 p.m. for probation review hearing in Branch 36.

Defendant Dartavius L Spencer in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
As to count 1:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
As to count 2:
Pursuant to negotiations and on motion of the state, court ordered count 2 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
.
Sentencing continued...
.
As to count 1:
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:
- Serve 30 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Defendant to notify agent if he has AODA issues.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by agent.   Defendant may have 3rd party contact for time with the child.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.

Defense motion for expungement denied by the court.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dartavius L Spencer in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
At the request of defense counsel, case is calendared for a plea and sentencing in Branch 36.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Dartavius L Spencer not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requested a scheduling conference date as defense counsel will likely be assigned to the defendant's new case #15CM2128. Case adjourned to Branch 36.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dartavius L Spencer in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
There is another arrest warrant out for the defendant.
Case adjourned for a status date in Branch 36.
  Status conference scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
STATE SUBPOENA FOR AUGUST 12, 2015 @ 8:30 AM RECEIVED AND FILED

Defendant Dartavius L Spencer in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to a branch of the Circuit Court to be determined.All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dartavius L Spencer in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Molly Schmidt for Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. FILE NOT IN COURT. Case set for Pretrial Conference. Case adjourned off the record. Defense counsel requests and adjournment for a Scheduling Conference.  Adjournment Form, filed. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.S. and A.S.

The Court ordered no possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dartavius L Spencer in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Dartavius L Spencer in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
